AccountId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

Currency.description: Identification of the currency in which the account is held.  Usage: Currency should only be used in case one and the same account number covers several currencies and the initiating party needs to identify which currency needs to be used for settlement on the account.

Nickname.description: The nickname of the account, assigned by the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account.

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

AccountGETResponse1PreviousPaymentAmount.description: The amount of the most recent direct debit collection.

Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Name.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

SecondaryIdentification.description: This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution.  This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

AccountGETResponseAccount.description: Provides the details to identify an account.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of the servicing institution.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

AccountGETResponseServicer.description: Party that manages the account on behalf of the account owner, that is manages the registration and booking of entries on the account, calculates balances on the account and provides information about the account.

DTACCTUP.description: Date and time of last update to account information

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

AccountTransactionsGETResponseAmount.description: Amount of money in the cash entry.

CreditDebitIndicator.description: Indicates whether the balance is a credit or a debit balance. Usage: A zero balance is considered to be a credit balance.

Type.description: Balance type, in a coded form.

AccountTransactionsGETResponseBalance.description: Set of elements used to define the balance as a numerical representation of the net increases and decreases in an account after a transaction entry is applied to the account.

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

AccountTransactionsGETResponseBalanceAmo.description: Amount of money of the cash balance after a transaction entry is applied to the account..

Code.description: Specifies the family within a domain.

SubCode.description: Specifies the sub-product family within a specific family.

AccountTransactionsGETResponseBankTransa.description: Set of elements used to fully identify the type of underlying transaction resulting in an entry.

AccountId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

AddressLine.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, that is presented in free format text.

BookingDateTime.description: Date and time when a transaction entry is posted to an account on the account servicer's books. Usage: Booking date is the expected booking date, unless the status is booked, in which case it is the actual booking date.

CreditDebitIndicator.description: Indicates whether the transaction is a credit or a debit entry.

Status.description: Status of a transaction entry on the books of the account servicer.

TransactionId.description: Unique identifier for the transaction within an servicing institution. This identifier is both unique and immutable.

TransactionInformation.description: Further details of the transaction. This is the transaction narrative, which is unstructured text.

TransactionReference.description: Unique reference for the transaction. This reference is optionally populated, and may as an example be the FPID in the Faster Payments context.

ValueDateTime.description: Date and time at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit entry, or cease to be available to the account owner in case of a debit entry.  Usage: If entry status is pending and value date is present, then the value date refers to an expected/requested value date. For entries subject to availability/float and for which availability information is provided, the value date must not be used. In this case the availability component identifies the  number of availability days.

MerchantCategoryCode.description: Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.

MerchantName.description: Name by which the merchant is known.

AccountTransactionsGETResponseMerchantDe.description: Details of the merchant involved in the transaction.

Code.description: Proprietary bank transaction code to identify the underlying transaction.

Issuer.description: Identification of the issuer of the proprietary bank transaction code.

AccountTransactionsGETResponseProprietar.description: Set of elements to fully identify a proprietary bank transaction code.

CURRENCY.description: If dollar formatting, can optionally include currency.

DTASOF.description: Effective date of the given balance.

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

BalancesGETResponseAmount.description: Amount of money of the cash balance.

Included.description: Indicates whether or not the credit line is included in the balance of the account. Usage: If not present, credit line is not included in the balance amount of the account.

Type.description: Limit type, in a coded form.

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

BalancesGETResponseCreditLineAmount.description: Active Or Historic Currency Code and Amount

DISPLAYACCTID.description: Trimmed account number without extra characters.

SUPTXDL.description: Y if account supports transaction detail downloads, N if it is balance-only.

XFERDEST.description: Y if account is enabled as a destination for an intrabank or interbank transfer.

XFERSRC.description: Y if account is enabled as a source for an intrabank or interbank transfer.

LOSTSYNC.description: if the token in the synchronization request is older than the earliest entry in the servers history table. In this case, some responses have been lost. N if the token in the synchronization request is newer than or matches a token in the servers history table.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

INTRASYNCRS.description: Describes the intra-bank transfer synchronization information.

INTRATRNRS.description: Describes the intra-bank transfer transaction information.

RECINTRASYNCRS.description: Describes the recurring transfer synchronization information.

RECINTRATRNRS.description: Describes the recurring transfer transaction information.

STMTENDTRNRS.description: Describes the bank statement closing information.

Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Name.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

SecondaryIdentification.description: This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution.  This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

BeneficiariesGETResponseCreditorAccount.description: Provides the details to identify the beneficiary account.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of the servicing institution.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

BeneficiariesGETResponseServicer.description: Party that manages the account on behalf of the account owner, that is manages the registration and booking of entries on the account, calculates balances on the account and provides information about the account. This is the servicer of the beneficiary account.

AccountId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

BeneficiaryId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the beneficiary resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

Reference.description: Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

billid.description: ID of this biller at this bill publisher.

billpub.description: Official standard name of the bill publisher.

ACCRDINT.description: Accrued interest. This amount is not reflected in the <TOTAL> field of a containing aggregate.

BUYTYPE.description: The BUYTOCOVER buy type used to close short sales.

RELFITID.description: RELFITID used to relate transactions associated with mutual fund exchanges.

OPTBUYTYPE.description: The BUYTOOPEN buy type is like ordinary buying of option and works like stocks.

BUYTYPE.description: The BUYTOCOVER buy type used to close short sales.

MAIL.description: Electronic mail addressTo, from, message information.

CHKANDDEB.description: Total of checks and debits, including fees.

DEPANDCREDIT.description: Total of deposits and credits, including interest.

DTPOSTEND.description: End date of transaction data for this statement.

DTPOSTSTART.description: Start date of transaction data for this statement.

ORIGCURRENCY.description: Original currency, if different from CURDEF.

SHPERCTRCT.description: For options, number of shares per contract.

SUBACCTSEC.description: Sub-account type for the security: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

CONTRIBSECURITY.description: Identifies current contribution allocation for a security (1 or more).

AFTERTAXCONTRIBAMT.description: Fixed amount of each new employee pretax contribution allocated to this security.

AFTERTAXCONTRIBPCT.description: Percentage of each new employee after tax contribution allocated to this security.

MATCHCONTRIBPCT.description: Percentage of each new employer match contribution allocated to this security.

OTHERNONVESTAMT.description: Fixed amount of each new other employee contribution allocated to this security.

OTHERNONVESTPCT.description: Percentage of each new other employee contribution allocated to this security.

OTHERVESTAMT.description: Fixed amount of each new other employer contribution allocated to this security.

OTHERVESTPCT.description: Percentage of each new other employer contribution allocated to this security.

PRETAXCONTRIBAMT.description: Fixed amount of each new employer match contribution allocated to this security.

PRETAXCONTRIBPCT.description: Percentage of each new employee pretax contribution allocated to this security.

PROFITSHARINGCONTRIBAMT.description: Fixed amount of each new employer profit sharing contribution allocated to this security.

PROFITSHARINGCONTRIBPCT.description: Percentage of each new employer profit sharing contribution allocated to this security.

ROLLOVERCONTRIBAMT.description: Fixed amount of new rollover contributions allocated to this security.

ROLLOVERCONTRIBPCT.description: Percentage of new rollover contributions allocated to this security.

TOTAL.description: Sum of contributions from all fund sources.

SUPTXDL.description: Y if account supports transaction detail downloads, N if it is balance-only.

XFERDEST.description: Y if account is enabled as a destination for an intrabank or interbank transfer.

XFERSRC.description: Y if account is enabled as a source for an intrabank or interbank transfer.

DTPOSTEND.description: End date of transaction data for this statement

DTPOSTSTART.description: Start date of transaction data for this statement.

ORIGCURRENCY.description: Original currency, if different from CURDEF

PURANDADV.description: Total of purchases and cash advances.

CreditCardStatementEndResponse.description: Credit Card Statement End Response Information.

CCSTMTTRNRS.description: Credit card statement end response aggregate.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

CreditCardStatementEndTransactionRespons.description: Credit Card Statement End Transaction Response Information.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

CreditCardStatementTransactionResponse.description: Credit Card Statement Transaction Response Information.

CCSTMTENDTRNRS.description: Describes the credit card statement closing information.

CCSTMTTRNRS.description: Describes the credit card statement information.

CreditcardResponseMessageSetV1.description: The response that identify and describe credit card transactions and balances.

Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Name.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number. ASPSPs may carry out name validation for Confirmation of Payee, but it is not mandatory.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

SecondaryIdentification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

CreditorAccount.description: Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a person.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

CreditorAgent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.

CURRATE.description: Ratio of <CURDEF> currency to <CURSYM> currency, in decimal notation.

assetclass.description: Asset Class (at most one), DOMESTICBOND, INTLBOND, LARGESTOCK SMALLSTOCK, INTLSTOCK, MONEYMRKT, OTHER.

calltype.description: Type of next call. CALL, PUT, PREFUND, MATURITY.

couponfreq.description: When coupons mature. One of the following values: MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, SEMIANNUAL, ANNUAL, or OTHER.

couponrt.description: Bond coupon rate for next closest call date (at most one).

debtclass.description: Classification of debt. TREASURY, MUNICIPAL, CORPORATE, OTHER.

fiassetclass.description: Text string containing an FI defined asset class.

Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Name.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

SecondaryIdentification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

DebtorAccount.description: Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a person.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

DebtorAgent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.

AccountId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

DirectDebitId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the direct debit resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

DirectDebitStatusCode.description: Specifies the status of the direct debit in code form.

MandateIdentification.description: Direct Debit reference. For AUDDIS service users provide Core Reference. For non AUDDIS service users provide Core reference if possible or last used reference.

PreviousPaymentDateTime.description: Date of most recent direct debit collection.

AFTERTAX.description: Current value of all securities purchased with After Tax Employee contributions.

MATCH.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Employer Match contributions.

OTHERNONVEST.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Other (non-vesting) Employer contributions.

OTHERVEST.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Other (vesting) Employer contributions.

PRETAX.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Before Tax Employee contributions.

PROFITSHARING.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Employer Profit Sharing contributions.

ROLLOVER.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Rollover contributions.

TOTAL.description: Current value of all securities purchased with all contributions.

ESCRWFEES.description: Amount of fees set aside in Escrow.

ESCRWINS.description: Amount of insurance set aside in Escrow.

ESCRWOTHER.description: Amount of other amount set aside in Escrow.

ESCRWPMI.description: Amount of PMI set aside in Escrow.

ESCRWTAX.description: Amount of tax set aside in Escrow.

ESCRWTOTAL.description: Total amount of payment applied to Escrow.

DAYSTOPAY.description: Minimum number of business days needed to process.

IDSCOPE.description: Scope of the payee ID; one of (GLOBAL, USER).

PAYEEID.description: Server payee identifier (required if assigned). Either <PAYEEID> or <PAYEE> can be sent, but not both.

FinancialInstitutionMutualFundAssetClass.description: Financial Institution Mutual Fund Asset Class Information.

FIASSETCLASS.description: Text string containing an FI defined asset class.

PERCENT.description: Percentage of the fund that falls under this asset class.

DURATION.description: How long the order is good for: DAY, GOODTILCANCEL, IMMEDIATE

INV401KSOURCE.description: For 401(k) accounts, source of money for this order.

MEMO.description: Other information about order (at most one).

MINUNITS.description: Minimum number of units that must be filled for the order.

RESTRICTION.description: Special restriction on the order: ALLORNONE, MINUNITS, NONE.

SUBACCT.description: Sub-account type. CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

UNITS.description: Quantity of the security the open order is for.

CURRENCY.description: Overriding currency aggregate for unit price.

DTASOF.description: Date as of for the unit price.

FIID.description: FI ID number for this security (at most one).

IMAGEDELAY.description: Number of calendar days from <DTSERVER> (for statement images) or <DTPOSTED> (for transaction images) when image will become available.

IMAGEREF.description: Server specified unique identifier for the image to be used during the request for the image. Can be either image identifier or URL, depending on the value of <IMAGEREFTYPE>.

IMAGETTL.description: Number of calendar days the image will remain available on the host once the image becomes available.

InceptToDate.description: The entity corresponding to the ofx element INCEPTTODATE.

INV401KSOURCE.description: For 401(k) accounts, source of money for this order.

SUBACCTFUND.description: Where did the money for the transaction come from or go to? CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

Income.description: Investment income is realized as cash into the investment account.

SRVRTID.description: ID of the transfer the user wants to cancel. The server must have previously assigned this ID to a transfer.
ID assigned by the server to the transfer being modified.

CURDEF.description: Default currency for the intrabank transfer response.

DTXFERPRJ.description: Projected date of the transfer; response can contain either a <DTXFERPRJ> or a <DTPOSTED> but not both.

RECSRVRTID.description: If the response is generated by a recurring transfer model, this ID references it.

LOSTSYNC.description: if the token in the synchronization request is older than the earliest entry in the servers history table. In this case, some responses have been lost. N if the token in the synchronization request is newer than or matches a token in the servers history table.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

BROKERCONTACTINFO.description: Name of contact person at broker, plus any available contact information, such as phone number.

CONTRIBINFO.description: Aggregate to describe how new contributions are distributed among the available securities.

CURRENTVESTPCT.description: Estimated percentage of employer contributions vested as of the current date. If omitted, assume 100%.

DEFERPCTAFTERTAX.description: Percent of employee salary deferred after tax.

DEFERPCTPRETAX.description: Percent of employee salary deferred before tax.

EMPLOYERCONTACTINFO.description: Name of contact person at employer, plus any available contact information, such as phone number.

LOANINFO.description: List of loans outstanding against this account. 0 or more.

MATCHINFO.description: Aggregate containing employer match information. Absent if employer does not contribute matching funds.

PLANJOINDATE.description: Date the employee joined the plan.

VESTINFO.description: Vest change dates. Provides the vesting percentage as of any particular past, current, or future date. 0 or more.

AFTERTAX.description: Current value of all securities purchased with After Tax Employee contributions.

BALLIST.description: Beginning of generic balance list (at most one).

CASHBAL.description: Cash balance available for the 401(k) account.

MATCH.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Employer Match contributions.

OTHERNONVEST.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Other (non-vesting) Employer contributions.

OTHERVEST.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Other (vesting) Employer contributions.

PRETAX.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Before Tax Employee contributions.

PROFITSHARING.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Employer Profit Sharing contributions.

ROLLOVER.description: Current value of all securities purchased with Rollover contributions.

TOTAL.description: Current value of all securities purchased with all contributions.

YEARTODATE.description: Contributions to date for this calendar year.

CHECKING.description: Whether the account has check writing privileges.

OPTIONLEVEL.description: Text description of option trading privileges.

SVCSTATUS.description: Activation status for investment statement download for the account. ACTIVE (signed up), PEND (in the process of signing up), AVAIL (have not signed up).

AVAILCASH.description: Cash balance across all sub-accounts. Should include sweep funds.

BALLIST.description: Beginning of Investment balance list (at most one)

MARGINBALANCE.description: Margin balance. A positive balance indicates a positive cash balance, while a negative balance indicates the customer has borrowed funds.

SHORTBALANCE.description: Market value of all short positions.

SUBACCTFUND.description: The sub-account associated with the funds for the transaction.

InvestmentBankTransaction.description: Banking-related transactions for the investment account (zero or more).

CURRENCY.description: Overriding currency aggregate for unit price.

DTPAYROLL.description: For 401(k)accounts, date the funds for this transaction was obtained via payroll deduction.

INV401KSOURCE.description: For 401(k) accounts, source of money used for this security.

LOANID.description: For 401(k) accounts only. Indicates that the transaction was due to a loan or a loan repayment, and which loan it was.

LOANINTEREST.description: For 401(k) accounts only. Indicates how much of the loan repayment was interest.

LOANPRINCIPAL.description: For 401(k) accounts only. Indicates how much of the loan repayment was principal.

MARKUP.description: Portion of the unit price that is attributed to the dealer markup.

PRIORYEARCONTRIB.description: For 401(k) accounts, indicates that this Buy was made with a prior year contribution.

SUBACCTFUND.description: Where did the money for the transaction come from or go to? CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

SUBACCTSEC.description: Sub-account type for the security: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

UNITPRICE.description: Price per commonly-quoted unit. Does not include markup/markdown. Share price for stocks, mutual funds, and others.

UNITS.description: For security-based actions other than stock splits. Shares for stocks, mutual funds, and others.

INV401KSOURCE.description: For 401(k) accounts, source of money used for this security.

SUBACCTFUND.description: Where did the money for the transaction come from or go to? CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

SUBACCTSEC.description: Sub-account type for the security: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

InvestmentExpense.description: Misc. investment expense that is associated with a specific security.

INVACCTFROM.description: Investment account of interest; token must be interpreted in terms of this account.

CURRENCY.description: Currency information if different from default currency.

DTPRICEASOF.description: Date and time of unit price and market value, and cost basis. If this date is unknown, use 19900101 as the placeholder; do not use 0.

INV401KSOURCE.description: Source of money for this security in this position.

POSTYPE.description: SHORT = Writer for options, Short for all others. LONG = Holder for options, Long for all others.

UNITPRICE.description: For stocks, MFs, other, price per share.

UNITS.description: For stocks, MFs, other, number of shares held.

POSDEBT.description: Security type specific position aggregates (zero or more).

POSMF.description: Security type specific position aggregates (zero or more).

POSOPT.description: Security type specific position aggregates (zero or more).

POSOTHER.description: Security type specific position aggregates (zero or more).

POSSTOCK.description: Security type specific position aggregates (zero or more).

CURRENCY.description: Overriding currency aggregate for unit price.

INV401KSOURCE.description: For 401(k) accounts, source of money used for this security.

LOANID.description: For 401(k) accounts only. Indicates that the transaction was due to a loan or a loan repayment, and which loan it was.

MARKDOWN.description: Portion of the unit price that is attributed to the dealer markdown.

PENALTY.description: Indicates an amount withheld due to a penalty.

STATEWITHHOLDING.description: Used for withholdings for state taxes on a withdrawal.

SUBACCTFUND.description: Where did the money for the transaction come from or go to? CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

SUBACCTSEC.description: Sub-account type for the security: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

UNITPRICE.description: Price per commonly-quoted unit. Does not include markup/markdown.

UNITS.description: For security-based actions other than stock splits.

CURDEF.description: Default currency used for closing information.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

DTASOF.description: As of date & time for the statement download.

InvestmentStatementResponse.description: Aggregate for the investment statement download response.

INVMAILSYNCRS.description: Describes the investment mail sync information.

INVSTMTENDTRNRS.description: Describes the investment statement end information.

InvestmentStatementResponseMessageSetV1.description: The response that identify and describe investment transactions and balances.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

INVSTMTRS.description: Aggregate for the investment statement download response/.

DTSETTLE.description: Settlement date; for stock splits, execution date.

DTTRADE.description: Trade date; for stock splits, day of record.

FITID.description: Unique FI-assigned transaction ID. This ID is used to detect duplicate downloads.

MEMO.description: Other information about transaction (at most one).

REVERSALFITID.description: For a reversal transaction, the FITID of the transaction that is being reversed.

CLOSUREOPT.description: Close a position for an option.

DTEND.description: This is the value that should be sent in the next <DTSTART> request to insure that no transactions are missed.

INCOME.description: Investment income is realized as cash into the investment account.

INVBANKTRAN.description: Banking-related transactions for the investment account (zero or more).

INVEXPENSE.description: Misc. investment expense that is associated with a specific security.

JRNLFUND.description: Journaling cash holdings between sub-accounts within the same investment account.

JRNLSEC.description: Journaling security holdings between sub-accounts within the same investment account.

SELLDEBT.description: Sell debt security. Used when debt is sold, called, or reached maturity.

TRANSFER.description: Transfer holdings in and out of the investment account.

SUBACCTFROM.description: Sub-account that security or cash is being transferred from: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

SUBACCTTO.description: Sub-account that security or cash is being transferred to: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

JournalFund.description: Journaling cash holdings between sub-accounts within the same investment account.

SUBACCTTO.description: Sub-account that security or cash is being transferred to: CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

UNITS.description: For security-based actions other than stock splits.

JournalSecurity.description: Journaling security holdings between sub-accounts within the same investment account.

BALLOONAMT.description: Not included or zero for regular loans, otherwise Balloon amount.

SUPTXDL.description: Y if account supports transaction detail downloads, N if it is balance-only.

XFERDEST.description: Y if account is enabled as a destination for an intrabank or interbank transfer.

XFERSRC.description: Y if account is enabled as a source for an intrabank or interbank transfer.

DTASOF.description: Date and time of the current loan balance.

LOANINTERESTTODATE.description: Total interested paid to date on this loan.

LOANTOTALPROJINTEREST.description: Total projected interest to be paid on this loan.

LoanInfo.description: List of loans outstanding against an account.

DTASOF.description: Date and time of the current interest information.

LOANINTLTD.description: Total interest paid loan to date.

LOANINTPRJ.description: Total projected interest to be paid on this loan.

LOANINTYTD.description: Total interest paid year to date.

DTASOF.description: Date and time of the current interest rate.

INSURANCE.description: Life, accident, health insurance on loan.

INTAMT.description: Amount of payment applied to interest.

PRINAMT.description: Amount of payment applied to Principal.

INCIMAGES.description: Include images in the message body.

MSGBODY.description: Body of message, HTML-encoded or plain text depending on <USEHTML>. HTML-encoded text - A-10000. Plain text - A-2000.

SUBJECT.description: Subject of message (plain text, not HTML).

TO.description: Who the message should be delivered to.

USEHTML.description: Y for HTML-formatted text. N for plain text.

CURRENCY.description: Currency information if different from default currency.

SUBACCTFUND.description: Where did the money for the transaction come from or go to? CASH, MARGIN, SHORT, OTHER.

BASEMATCHAMT.description: Specifies a fixed dollar amount contributed by the employer if the employee participates in the plan at all. This may be present in addition to the <MATCHPCT>. $0 if omitted.

BASEMATCHPCT.description: Specifies a fixed percent of employee salary matched if the employee participates in the plan at all. This may be present in addition to the MATCHPCT>. 0% if omitted. Base match in a year is BASEMATCHPCT up to the BASEMATCHAMT,if provided.

MAXMATCHAMT.description: Maximum employer contribution amount in any year.

MAXMATCHPCT.description: Current maximum employer contribution percentage. Maximum match in a year is MAXMATCHPCT up to the MAXMATCHAMT, if provided.

STARTOFYEAR.description: Specifies when the employer contribution max is reset. Some plans have a maximum based on the company fiscal year rather than calendar year. Assume calendar year if omitted. Only the month and day (MMDD) are used; year (YYYY) and time are ignored.

MatchInfo.description: Aggregate containing employer match information. Absent if employer does not contribute matching funds.

MetaData.description: Meta Data relevant to the payload

PORTION.description: Portion of the mutual fund with a specific asset classification.

MutualFundAssetClass.description: Asset class breakdown for the mutual fund.

FIMFASSETCLASS.description: FI defined asset class breakdown for the mutual fund.

MFASSETCLASS.description: Asset class breakdown for the mutual fund.

MFTYPE.description: Mutual fund type. OPENEND, CLOSEEND, OTHER.

YIELD.description: Current yield reported as portion of the funds assets (at most one).

ASSETCLASS.description: Asset Class (at most one), DOMESTICBOND, INTLBOND, LARGESTOCK SMALLSTOCK, INTLSTOCK, MONEYMRKT, OTHER.

FIASSETCLASS.description: Text string containing an FI defined asset class.

OPTTYPE.description: Option type: PUT = put. CALL = call.

SECID.description: Security ID of the underlying security.

ASSETCLASS.description: Asset Class (at most one), DOMESTICBOND, INTLBOND, LARGESTOCK SMALLSTOCK, INTLSTOCK, MONEYMRKT, OTHER.

FIASSETCLASS.description: Text string containing an FI defined asset class.

ADDR3.description: Payees address line 3. Use of <ADDR3> requires the presence of <ADDR2>.

COUNTRY.description: Payees country; 3-letter country code from ISO/DIS-3166.

Payee.description: Specifies the complete billing address for a payee.

CHECKNUM.description: Check number assigned by the server to this payment.

SRVRTID.description: ID assigned by the server to the payment being queried.

DTPMTPRC.description: Payment processing date; interpretation depends on <PMTPRCCODE>.

SRVRTID.description: ID assigned by the server to the payment being created.

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 - Codes for the representation of currencies and funds.

PaymentSetupInitiationInstructedAmount.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party. Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

PaymentSetupPOSTResponseLinks.description: Link URIs relevant to the payload

PaymentSetupPOSTResponseMeta.description: Meta Data Relevant to the payload

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created.

PaymentId.description: OB: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the payment setup resource.

Status.description: Specifies the status of the payment resource.

PaymentSetupResponse.description: Reflection of The Main Data Payload, with Created Resource ID, Status and Timestamp

EndToEndIdentification.description: Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction. OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for the EndToEndIdentification field.

InstructionIdentification.description: Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction. Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

PaymentSetupResponseInitiation.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor.

PaymentId.description: OB: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the payment setup resource.

CreationDateTime.description: Date and time at which the resource was created.

PaymentId.description: OB: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the payment setup resource.

PaymentSubmissionId.description: OB: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the payment submission resource.

Status.description: Specifies the status of the payment submission resource.

BILLERID.description: ID of this biller at this bill publisher.

BILLPUB.description: Official standard name of bill publisher.

PAYEEID.description: Payee identifier. Identifies this Biller at the user's Payment provider.

PAYEELSTID.description: Payee list identifier. Identifies this Biller on the user's payee list at their Payment provider.

PresentmentAccount.description: Aggregate that uniquely identifies a customers account with a biller by the combination of bill publisher, biller ID, and account number.

PRESACCTFROM.description: Bill presentment account identification. Aggregate that uniquely identifies a customers account with a biller by the combination of bill publisher, biller ID, and account number.

REASON.description: Reason for rejection, relevant only if <SVCSTATUS>REJECTED is specified.

SVCSTATUS.description: Status of the Bill Presentment service for this account. Values are AVAIL, PEND, ACTIVE, or REJECTED.

BUSNAMEACCTHELD.description: Optional Does Business As name associated with this account.

COUNTRY.description: Customers country; 3-letter country code from ISO/DIS-3166.

NAMEACCTHELD.description: Customers name as it appears on the account.

DTASOF.description: Date and time of the current loan balance.

PRINLTD.description: Total principal paid loan to date.

PRINYTD.description: Total principal paid year to date.

AccountId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

ProductIdentifier.description: Identifier within the parent organisation for the product. Must be unique in the organisation.

ProductName.description: The name of the product used for marketing purposes from a customer perspective. I.e. what the customer would recognise.

ProductType.description: Descriptive code for the product category.

SecondaryProductIdentifier.description: Identifier within the parent organisation for the product. Must be unique in the organisation.

AccountId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

CreditDebitIndicator.description: Indicates whether the balance is a credit or a debit balance. Usage: A zero balance is considered to be a credit balance.

DateTime.description: Indicates the date (and time) of the balance.

Type.description: Balance type, in a coded form.

RECSRVRTID.description: D assigned by the server to the model being canceled.
ID assigned by the server to the model being modified.

LOSTSYNC.description: if the token in the synchronization request is older than the earliest entry in the servers history table. In this case, some responses have been lost. N if the token in the synchronization request is newer than or matches a token in the servers history table.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

Reference.description: Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.  Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification. OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only accept 18 characters for the ReferenceInformation field - which is where this ISO field will be mapped.

Unstructured.description: Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

RemittanceInformation.description: Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system.

MerchantCategoryCode.description: Category code conforms to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction

MerchantCustomerIdentification.description: The unique customer identifier of the PSU with the merchant.

MerchantCategoryCode.description: Category code conforms to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction

MerchantCustomerIdentification.description: The unique customer identifier of the PSU with the merchant.

AddressLine.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, that is presented in free format text.

BuildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

Country.description: Nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

CountrySubDivision.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country, for instance state, region, county.

PostCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail

StreetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare

TownName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

RiskDeliveryAddress.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services or in free format text.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

AccountId.description: The date on which the first payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.

FinalPaymentDateTime.description: The date on which the final payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.

FirstPaymentDateTime.description: The date on which the first payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.

Frequency.description: EvryWorkgDay - PSC070 IntrvlWkDay:PSC110:PSC080 (PSC070 code + PSC110 + PSC080) WkInMnthDay:PSC100:PSC080 (PSC070 code + PSC100 + PSC080) IntrvlMnthDay:PSC120:PSC090 (PSC070 code + PSC120 + PSC090) QtrDay: + either (ENGLISH, SCOTTISH or RECEIVED) PSC070 + PSC130 The following response codes may be generated by this data element: PSC070: T221 - Schedule code must be a valid enumeration value. PSC070: T245 - Must be provided for standing order only. PSC080: T222 - Day in week must be within defined bounds (range 1 to 5). PSC080: T229 - Must be present if Schedule Code = IntrvlWkDay. PSC080: T231 - Must be present if Schedule Code = WkInMnthDay. PSC090: T223 - Day in month must be within defined bounds (range -5 to 31 excluding: 0 & 00). PSC090: T233 - Must be present if Schedule Code = IntrvlMnthDay. PSC100: T224 - Week in month must be within defined bounds (range 1 to 5). PSC100: T232 - Must be present if Schedule Code = WkInMnthDay. PSC110: T225 - Interval in weeks must be within defined bounds (range 1 to 9). PSC110: T230 - Must be present if Schedule Code = IntrvlWkDay. PSC120: T226 - Interval in months must be a valid enumeration value (range 1 to 6, 12 and 24). PSC120: T234 - Must be present if Schedule Code = IntrvlMnthDay. PSC130: T227 - Quarter Day must be a valid enumeration value. PSC130: T235 - Must be present if Schedule Code = QtrDay. The regular expression for this element combines five smaller versions for each permitted pattern. To aid legibility - the components are presented individually here: EvryWorkgDay IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-5] WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-5] IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]) QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED) Mandatory/Conditional/Optional/Parent/Leaf: OL Type: 35 char string Regular Expression(s): (EvryWorkgDay)|(IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-5])|(WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-5])|(IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1- 6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]))|(QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED))

NextPaymentDateTime.description: The date on which the next payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.

Reference.description: Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

StandingOrderId.description: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the standing order resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

StandingOrdersGETResponseFinalPaymentAmo.description: The amount of the final Standing Order

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 'Codes for the representation of currencies and funds'

StandingOrdersGETResponseNextPaymentAmou.description: The amount of the next Standing Order

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of the servicing institution.

SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

StandingOrdersGETResponseServicer.description: Party that manages the account on behalf of the account owner, that is manages the registration and booking of entries on the account, calculates balances on the account and provides information about the account. This is the servicer of the beneficiary account

CLOSING.description: Aggregate to describe statement closing information.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

BANKACCTTO.description: If this was a transfer to an account and the account information is available.

CCACCTTO.description: If this was a transfer to an account and the account information is available.

CORRECTACTION.description: Actions can be REPLACE or DELETE. REPLACE replaces the transaction referenced by CORRECTFITID; DELETE deletes it.

CORRECTFITID.description: If present, the FITID of a previously sent transaction that is corrected by this record.

DTPOSTED.description: Date transaction was posted to account.

EXTDNAME.description: Extended name of payee or description of transaction.

FITID.description: Transaction ID issued by financial institution.

IMAGEDATA.description: Image data aggregate, up to 2 allowed.

INV401KSOURCE.description: Source of cash for this transaction.

NAME.description: Name of payee or description of transaction.

REFNUM.description: Reference number that uniquely identifies the transaction.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

MESSAGE.description: A textual explanation from the FI.

SEVERITY.description: Severity of the error: INFO = Informational only, WARN = Some problem with the request occurred but a valid response still present, ERROR = A problem severe enough that response could not be made.

Status.description: Aggregate to provide error reporting feedback.

CHKSTATUS.description: Status code for individual stop check request 0 = OK, 1 = rejected, 100 = check not found, 101 = check already posted.

CURDEF.description: Default currency for stop check response.

LOSTSYNC.description: if the token in the synchronization request is older than the earliest entry in the servers history table. In this case, some responses have been lost. N if the token in the synchronization request is newer than or matches a token in the servers history table.

CLTCOOKIE.description: Data to be echoed in the transaction response.

BANKACCTTO.description: Destination account information for systems that pay by transfers (<PAYEE> also required).

BILLPUBINFO.description: Bill publisher information aggregate for the payment.

BILLREFINFO.description: Biller-supplied reference information when paying a bill, if available.

DTDUE.description: Payment due date or the date by which payment must be received by payee.

EXTDPMT.description: Zero or more extended Payment aggregates.

PAYACCT.description: User account number with the payee.

PAYEE.description: Complete payee billing information. Either <PAYEEID> or <PAYEE> can be sent, but not both.

PAYEEID.description: Server payee identifier (required if assigned). Either <PAYEEID> or <PAYEE> can be sent, but not both.

DTDUE.description: Date that the transfer is to be sent.
